English.Char_Desc_2000:
Notetask is a free and open-source cross-platform task manager and note-taking application for Windows and Linux, written in Lazarus (Free Pascal). The core idea of Notetask is simple: it stores tasks and notes in plain text files, where each line represents a separate task or note. Users can also choose to save their files in an encrypted format for personal information, while all data remains local to their device.
Notetask provides a customizable interface and a range of features to manage tasks effectively, including automatic numbering, paged task groups with duration and amount tracking, task merging, splitting, archiving, indentation, highlighting for overdue or upcoming tasks, copy/paste in Markdown, and an optional encrypted file format. It is fully Unicode-enabled and localized in 25 languages.
Changelog (v1.1.0)
New Features - Implement real-time task filtering for all visible groups and tasks - Highlight text fragments found by filter in the grid - Implement full tag support in task file - Dropdown check-list in tag input allows selecting existing tags or removing them - Add Zoom functionality for the grid with control via View menu, mouse wheel, hotkeys, or status bar - Add tooltips for groups, stored in the file after comment marker - Search and highlight cell text matching current cell - Build a single InnoSetup installer for all architectures - Add 32-bit build - Add translations for cs, da, nl, fi, el, he, id, pl, ro, sv, tr - Open a link from notes or grid with Ctrl + Click
Enhancements - Switch groups using NUMPAD+ and NUMPAD- - Save print settings, print tags behind task text - Change MD format, place tags closer to task text - Allow writing links in task text - Move task to top/bottom before first/last visible non-archived task if archive hidden - Check for updates via wget on Linux - Render sorting arrow in fixed column
